Class PokerClient

java.lang.Object
com.dnikitin.poker.client.PokerClient
public class PokerClient extends Object
Main entry point for the Poker Client application.

This class handles the TCP connection to the server, processes incoming protocol messages, and delegates user commands to the network stream. It uses a separate virtual thread to listen for asynchronous server messages while the main thread handles user input.

      public PokerClient(String host, int port, ClientGameState gameState, ConsoleUI ui, ServerMessageParser parser)
      Dependency Injection constructor for testing purposes. Allows injecting mock GameState, UI, or Parser components.
      Parameters:
      host - Server hostname.
      port - Server port.
      gameState - The shared game state object.
      ui - The UI handler.
      parser - The protocol parser.

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start()
      Starts the client: connects to the server, spawns the listener thread, and enters the main user input loop.

      Blocks until the user types 'quit' or the connection is lost.

    • createSocket

      protected Socket createSocket(String host, int port) throws IOException
      Factory method for creating the socket. Override this to mock the connection.
      Parameters:
      host - Hostname.
      port - Port number.
      Returns:
      A connected Socket.
      Throws:
      IOException - If connection fails.

      public static void main(String[] args)
